summary: This bill, the Caribbean Border Counternarcotics Strategy Act, aims to strengthen the federal government's efforts to prevent drug trafficking through the Caribbean region into the United States. It amends the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998, establishing a Caribbean border counternarcotics strategy. The strategy will outline roles, responsibilities, resources needed, and will consider Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands specifically. It aims to reduce drug-related violent crime and includes recommendations for additional assistance to law enforcement.
